pr_title: fix near-distance for chained searches in dstu3

timeline.message:
began with failing test.
test now passes.

timeline.bodyText: Any clue why this was commented out in the first place? Seems this test is just a test to see if searching by code text works...
timeline.author: tadgh

replies.bodyText: No idea.  I was helping Ruslan with something and came across it.  They were commented out 3 years ago.  I uncommented them, the test passed, so why not?
replies.author: fil512

timeline.bodyText: Ha, I like these example coordinates
timeline.author: tadgh

timeline.bodyText: Suggestion: would be great if we could get docstrings on public methods and the class, explaining what's going on inside.
timeline.author: tadgh

timeline.bodyText: Question: Is location ripped into a constant somewhere? If so, would be nice to use that here instead of the hard-coded string.
timeline.author: tadgh

replies.bodyText: Completely agree.  I looked around, and could not find a good source for it.  It's really referring to a named path in multiple resources and their shared naming is convention, not structural, so I left it as a string.
replies.author: fil512

timeline.bodyText: I'm sure they are identical, but since this is an STU3 issue based on what you said, should we use the dstu3.resource.Location.SP_NEAR_DISTANCE ?
timeline.author: tadgh

replies.bodyText: That was my intention--I could have sworn I fixed that.  Strange.  Fixed again
replies.author: fil512

timeline.bodyText:
This function is a tad messy. I'm trying to think of ways in which we could simplify this, as its starting to look like arrow code. Am I right in thinking the pseudocode For this is essentially:
1. Stream over all ParamAndLists and their child ParamOrLists
2. if more than a single Param of type SP_NEAR_DISTANCE  exists, cumulatively, over any of the ParamOrLists, then throw illegal argument exception. 
3. If 0 exist, return null, 
4. If exactly 1 exists, return it, but also remove it from its paramOrList, and if that causes the subsequent parent ParamAndList to be empty, remove it too.

Have I got the gist?
timeline.author: tadgh

replies.bodyText: Yes!  This yucky method is the reason why I spent an hour trying to do this processing at the point where search parameters are added initially.  I'd love to see a cleaner way to write this if you can come up with a way.
replies.author: fil512

replies.bodyText: I may be able to streamify this stuff, but the fact that we have to remove the offending params post-selection means its probably gonna stay yucky. Let's open an issue to just think about this I think. I'll poke at it when I've got some downtime
replies.author: tadgh

timeline.author: tadgh

replies.bodyText: Much nicer!  I replaced with your code and re-ran all the tests.
replies.author: fil512
